Message:
“Eight hundred ninety-seven...
Eight hundred ninety-eight...
Eight hundred nine...ty-nine...
Nrgh...!”

Partway through training,
the pain forced me to stop
and sheathe my blade.

As I removed the bloodstained
bandages from my hands,
I wasn’t surprised to see my old
blisters once again torn open.

The healer will surely
chastise me once more.

But, if I cannot carry on
with my training...

“One’s worth lies in
the strength of their blade.”

Suddenly, my father’s words
resurface in my mind.

They repeat relentlessly,
like an echo rolling
over the mountaintops.

Am I truly void of any right
to wield this blade...?

An artisan’s chisel
carves out magnificence.
A woodcutter’s axe fells
even the tallest of trees.

But for me...what purpose
does my blade serve...?

Upon hearing my name,
I raised my head,
and before me, he stood...
